metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29383 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In Shadow 4.13, it is possible to inject control characters into fields provided to the SUID program chfn (change finger). Although it is not possible to exploit this directly (e.g., adding a new user fails because \n is in the block list), it is possible to misrepresent the /etc/passwd file when viewed. Use of \r manipulations and Unicode characters to work around blocking of the : character make it possible to give the impression that a new user has been added. In other words, an adversary may be able to convince a system administrator to take the system offline (an indirect, social-engineered denial of service) by demonstrating that "cat /etc/passwd" shows a rogue user account.

criterions.comment: shadow: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
